intro: Adenocalymma comosum var. typicum, commonly known as the clustered adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, branched growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically narrow and leathery, adapted to reduce water loss in its arid environment. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
